description: A simple, attractive way to take linked notes.
Work great, easy to use. The dark-blue hyperlinks against a black background is pretty rough but I was able to edit the link colors in the local config file,

I've tried many solutions for note-taking and task management over the years. Paper based, full-featured applications, hosted services, the powerful Emacs Org-mode, but I aways come back to Zim. The ease of use is just amazing. with a great set of options from the menu, and a decent set of shortcuts to speed up your workflow later on. Personally I hardly use the tagging feature, but still being able to search and jump through my notes, and easily restructure them is golden. The underlying file structure of plaintext files is convenient if you are switching note taking solutions, or if you want to view your notes with a tool other than Zim.
summary: My second brain for many years

description:
Works very well as an organizer for thoughts, ideas, files, links, diary and projects. Organizing everything requires some effort up front, but having everything in the right place is an awesome thing.

I use Zim Wiki every single day. I like it especially because the storage format is future proof. Synchronizing works with most any service (I use syncthing). I can use Zim on both Linux and Windows, and access and read the files on my mobile phone too. Microsoft Onenote might be better in some cases, but it is not Free Software, and certainly not future proof or compatible with anything else.
Love how zim works based on text fields. Supports version controlling and the workflow is amazing, feels really easy to use.
summary: Haven't seen a better note management solution

description:
I've tried a list of application which I wanted to use as replacement for Evernote. I used Evernote for many years and I had my personal agenda and GTD system in it.
Now, after moved this data into ZimWiki and Evernote is history for me.

Application is lightweight, fully featured and extensible. 

You can run wiki as a server but easiest way to share which I use is Dropbox. I'm sharing data also between different operation system.

I've been using zim for two years now, after many years of using other note-taking apps. The simplicity and practicality is just amazing. Great set of plugins - one of the main reasons I migrated from older apps (like Gnote) is the Table-Of-Contents plugin. Not to mention that each note is a simple, readable text file. Drag and drop simple bitmap images.
I use it at home on my Fedora desktop, and at work on my work-laptop running windows. I use it daily: I keep notes, to-do-lists and meeting minutes for large projects, all neatly organized by project folders and sub-folders, and also 'learning' notes. 
The day it supports some sort of vector graphics, that would be nirvana. It's pretty good as it is though.
summary: Using it at work and at home

description: Amazingly good note taking application if your needs exceeds what Gnote has to offer.
If you want to create a personal wiki without setting up a server and some serious software, ZimWiki is what you want. It's a really useful tool for taking notes and storing information!
It is very useful for me, I have hundreds of articles written using this marvelous software.
Helps organize the entire computer. Hierarchical folders and plain text files mean zim is extremely reliable. Encryption is supported, as are a whole host of features.
My work, trips, hobbies and everything is documented with Zim. It's a really amazing application.
The perfect persona wiki.

I've been using it for revision and it's excellent for organising notes and showing which subject areas are related. If yo
If you're a student, I'd consider this program essential.
got nothing on cherrytree

A solid and well-thought-out app, kind of an information junk drawer that can be as organized or chaotic as i want. It's dead simple to use and just complex enough to do the fancy stuff i need -- prioritized to-do lists, bookmarks, sorting (all available as optional plug-ins). I've got seven Zim wikis running now, and use them daily. Hourly.
I would like to change the color of the text, but further unbeatable.

As much as I like CherryTree, I think its auto save keeps crashing it even when you opt to stop auto-save. I.m n the middle of project so I can sit her and do QA for this as much as I wish I could. So ZIM sounds like a better bet for now. But it is a Wiki and requires running the wiki server that CherryTree doesn't as a stand alone XML document which can be sent to other computers I own with CherryTree installed. So it is limited to use only in my home network.
summary: Trying something that won't crash unlike CherryTree

description:
Tree-structure + tags is the ultimate way to organize pretty much any collection of notes.

Add markup capability - perfect way to mark and emphasize anything within a note. 

Add 4-state checkbox (unchecked, pending, not done, done) with tabs, and you have an ultimate to-do list.

Add extensibility with modules (like "journal") and you have a community of users.

Also it's relatively easy to tweak it's appearance through config.

---

One thing i wish it had is a possibility to sort pages in a tree manually, and not alphabetically, and put emoji as first character in a headline.
summary: Not just a personal wiki. Better than Evernote

description:
Before, I used to write notes with plain text editors like GNU Nano, but using Zim is nice because you just launch it and all your notes are in one place.
I did once notice some issues with the side pane not refreshing, or refreshing weirdly, after deleting many pages, but this went away after restarting the application

I transfered 650mb of notes into this and it works great. There's still room for improvement, and to be honest, I believe this Zim could become the focus of my whole days work. For personal use, AMAZING 5 stars, for uploading to a website, 5 stars again; because it allows users to publish their wiki without other people interfering. That was what I wanted and other wiki just allowed anyone to tamper with things. Clean efficient interface, as one other person mentioned in their review, it would be nice to have coloured text, but that's a minor consideration. Thank you ZIM!
For brainstorming and adding text materials its a very versatile tool. With its simple gui and simple interface you can be so productive with this tool. Its simply the best!
summary: The best Note organizer and writing tool

description: I really like this one. It's fast, light, and very versatile.
Keep all my uni notes in this and plenty of extensions.
One column on the left showing the menus, and the other on the right showing the contents.
summary: How to make a two column website?

description:
Excellent note application, clearly written and thought out by a developer that uses it himself all day. Easy and intuitive to use, but also very powerfull. Features full wysiwyg editing with very easy link creation to any resources inside and outside the notebook. Features powerful addons, such as the tasks list, which collects tasks that may exist anywhere between your notes into a central location for follow up.
Big shout out and thumbs up to Jaap Karssenberg, the developper.

Used it for 5 years or more. Very fast and simple to search text.
Only regret : no notes encryption

Easy to use! I've been looking for an application like this, in place of Jupyter. Found it!
Light weight and quick!
Thanks.

I've been using this excellent little app for 10 years now. I don't know why the license type is given here as proprietary - this is free software, as the website makes clear. Can whoever is running the software store correct this error, as it might put some people off.

I use it for years now, both at work and at home. Can't leave without, all my long term memory and todo items are managed with Zim. 
It's really light weight and has ton of useful pluggins. As it says, it works for you and not the other way around! I wish I had time to actively contribute to the development.
good working no breaks, ok design
really love it, stable, light however i you can add table and dark theme for my eyes please.
I used sticky notes, and other methods to store quick pieces of info like git commands etc. This is the best way to organize all your quick reference things in a convenient way.

Use it all day long in Windows.
Now I can work with the same notebook in Linux and sync.

SUPER comfortable and handy program. No bugs.
summary: Been using it for years in windows, now synch. w/Linux works great !

description: it is good but when i am using some characters like {{}} that will be corrupted later. I hope this could be changed

I have inserted some screenshots from my Pictures folder into the document, and then deleted those pictures from filesystem. Emptied the trash bin and lost those valuable screenshots forever because this piece of software did not make a hard copy, but just inserted a link into the document.
summary: You risk losing your images with that program

description:
Starting a huge project, and this will keep it organized!! I love the links to existing stuff I have, I don't have to move everything to keep it in one place.

Thanks!

I gave a lot of other more sophisticated note-taking apps a try but found they were too bulky, fussy, cluttered with features ... Zim is lean, transparent, intuitive and the perfect way for me to organize all my notes, knowledge, my life basically.
Replacement of one note on linux, use dropbox to sync every device.

Simple and effective.

Notes are saved as text, if you don't want to use it anymore, you still have everything saved down with timestamps and so.

The app does support checkboxes and so on.

I got frustrated that I couldn't entirely trust Obsidian to be stable and uncompromised. Thank you for making a simple open editor for writing wikis. All I wanted was structured text and image insertion. Perfect.
summary: Thank you for an open wiki writer

description: I've been using Zim for the past three years to manage my daily to-do lists and note taking. It has an excellent interface that is easy to learn and use, and the fact it keeps all notes in plain-text is a big plus in my book. Perhaps the best thing I can say is that I've never considered switching to another note app since moving to Zim.

I hadn't realised until I came to write this review just how long I have been using Zim. I have looked for replacements but never found anything that worked offline, with a clean interface and data which is easy to share. It was quick and easy to master and has a straight forward approach to organising my many notes. It has a handy feature to export all or single notes as HTML. When used with a syncing program such as syncthing, it is very easy to keep notes up to date on multiple hosts.

This is a very strong personal knowledge base or notetaking application. It has good techniques for internal relationships, strong searches, and a pleasant, simple editor. It's a bit different from markdown but will import/export to markdown and other formats. Many extra features can be added with plugins, especially for academic purposes, like using with Zotero and if you want, you can customize much of its look-and-feel with css. 

It compares very favorably with applications like Zettlr or Trilium.
summary: Easy to learn with excellent features

description:
I always did write my notes and summaries as .txt or .odt , bbut nnow with this program it's way easier and pleasing .

great one , thanks for developers .
Couldn't even get it to open. Fresh Ubuntu 20.10 install running on Wayland. Maybe only works on Xorg?
cool so far great app

- Multi-level Structures
- Rich Text editor.
- Includes Pictures
- Simple to use. (No edit/view mode switching)
- Files can be synced
Missing features:
- Android client for editing/checking the PC notes on the go.
- Text needs bold + Italic at the same time.
- Move/convert tree structure into note indents. And note indents back to tree structure.
- Hotkey for Bullets + Numbered formatting
summary: Easy, structures overview of your complex info. The Best Outliner

description: It is very close to what I would like to use, namely a local wiki. But it lacks format text, boxing styles and tables to name a few. I will keep an eye of this. Maybe one day it will become a full fledged powerful local wiki.
summary: So close to what I need

description: I am so addicted to Zim. It is my personal wiki/ knowledgebase/ evernote replacement. It's so much faster and intuitive than other programs I have tried. It's not as pretty as Joplin or Standard Notes, but it's more practical, convenient and snappy. Zim is unassuming. You wouldn't expect it to be the best of the best. I think it's the easy, obvious structure that makes it awesome. All my Zim notes are saved in a folder in plain text files, so it's easy to move to different program if that ever needs to happen. It's easy to cut and paste for use in other programs, like if I want to draft an email in Zim and then paste it into my email program, the text is clean. It's the simplicity and ease of use that makes me keep coming back to Zim. Also it has more features than I even use, such as tagging, calendar journal and the ability to export the whole notebook into a website/ public wiki.
I have been using it for a long time, I use it to take not during calls, for cheatsheets and for quick notes saving
It's stupidly simple and unassuming, which is probably what makes it so good. No extra fuss, just a really good application to take notes with.
summary: Surprises you with how good it is

description: Not working on Fedora 35, causes endless indexing loop at start
I use this for all my system documentation and notes. It's a fantastic, easy to use, and more importantly easy to find everything in it.
Perfect for all of my school notes

Used it for a long time before switching to Notion and then to Obsidian.
The only thing i miss is 4-state checkbox, but even that can be added with obsidian add-ons.

Obsidian+SyncThing is just IMBA! If you love Zim, check it out!
One of the best notetaking apps out there

Excellent to record a lot of information while staying organized. It has auto-save and keyboard shortcuts for distraction-free editing (unlike traditional web-based wikis). It stores all notes in plaintext files in one folder, which makes it easy to backup and sync. The UI is customizable - I like it minimal, but there's also plenty of plugins.

The only downside is poor sandboxing. Some features do not work under Wayland. It tries to integrate with your desktop in ways that are hard to sandbox.
summary: Functionally perfect, but beware sandboxing issues

description:
Note taking, idea organizer and even diary

I don't know if I've been using it correctly. Because I even make my schedule with him.

For each idea, just select the word and link to create a page about the new idea.

Everything is very well organized. It is very good.
summary: Note taking, idea organizer and even diary

description: No clue why people still like to get blinded by white backgrounds. I'll try to remember to check this out again if a dark theme is ever implimented. I'm on my computer way too much to ruin my eyes.

Run these 2 commands:

-Command 1:
flatpak install Adwaita-dark

-Answer 'Y' to the questions it asks.

-Set the theme as default

-Command 2:
flatpak override --user --env=GTK_THEME=Adwaita-dark

Credit to reddit user: insulatedcat
From: r/SteamDeck
I use it to store notes, links sortef under topis/pages and subpages. Great way to make a study companion or generally take notes

I've been using this for a few weeks and I'm finding it easy to use and it works well for what I need.

It's a seriously stripped down application (with plugins for extra functions apart from text and embedding images/etc), it uses text files for storage (so you're not locked in) and acts like a wiki.

If you've used OneNote before, but you're looking for something non-proprietary and lightweight, try this. In my view, it's one of the best apps in Linux.
summary: Basic, but it seems to work well

description:
I've been looking for a similar tool for a while to compose and compile various notes relating to my job- something straight-forward and familiar. Installed on a whim for "Why not? It might be neat." and quickly found that I could use this to put together guidance for my colleagues.

Exporting to HTML, tools and settings for custom extensions, source editing? Very nice.

I'm lost without Zim! In a nutshell this thing organizes text files. I've used it for about the last four years for everything from a notepad to writing a book to keeping study notes to organizing crafting patterns and more (have another topic? just make another notebook). I admit, I wouldn't mind a little more glamorous solution when it comes to images but for the life of me I can't imagine trying to do what it does in another environment, and it was not for lack of trying.

The linking fonts is a dark neon-like blue, which is a strain on my vision. I would prefer the web-linkable fonts to be more of a flat blue, blue-green, or something comfortable on the eyes. 
I tried looking for something where the font colour could be changed, but couldn't find anything via any settings options, nor on the internet yet. I will try searching again. Otherwise, I do like this application.
summary: Linking Font too harsh on the eyes

description:
nichtmehr wegzudenken aus meinem workflow. 
simpel, offline nutzbar, unabhängig von einem riesen Konzern, sympathischer Entwickler, und alles auf simplen .txt-Dateien basiert, also kein proprietärer Mist :-) 
unbedingt mal antesten und supporten :-)

Endlich hab ich einen guten Editor für Notiz-Sammlungen gefunden!
Man kann formatierten Text und Bilder kombinieren und die Texte untereinander verlinken. Es gibt netterweise auch gleich eine Funktion, um die Links zu einem Text zu finden.

Kann das Programm weiterempfehlen! Einfacher Aufbau mit vielen Funktionen. Ich verwende es als Ersatz zu Evernote um wichtige Notizen zu verwalten und bei Projekten nicht den Überblick zu verlieren. Es können einfach Dateien zu den Notizen verwaltet werden und diese parallel bearbeitet werden.
summary: Super Tool für Notizen Protokolle und Aufgabenlisten

description: Zahlreiche plugins lassen kaum Wünsche offen.

Da für Linux und Windows (Firma) verfügbar überall einsetzbar. Auch die Speicherung aller Texte in normalen Textdateien ohne Spezialformate wie bei anderen Note-Programmen erleichtert die Weiterverarbeitung. Damit läuft eine Versionierung der Notiz wie z.B. mit git und allen dazu gehörigen Tools zum Editieren/mergen total unkompliziert.
Einfach sehr schnell und intuitiv. Mit Zim geht jeder Mitschrieb auch während eines Meetings in "Echtzeit" von der Hand. Für eine Überschrift nur ein Buchstabe der Zeile wählen und STRNG+1,2,3 und schon ist sie H1 H2 H3... (Kein langes Maus-Fummeln bis auch der letzte Buchstabe der Zeile eingefangen ist..). Aufzählungen einfach ein Sternchen davor und schon ist sie da. Einrücken, mega einfach ohne den Kampf gegen irgend welche "intelligenten" Automatismen...
Einzig eine individuelle Formatierung der Überschriften für ein kleines bisschen Corporate Identity wäre super. Nicht jedem gefällt dieses Grün
summary: So Gut, mittlerweile besitzt bei mir jedes Projekt ein Zim Wiki

description: Ich schätze dieses Programm, weil es mir ermöglicht Informationen aller Art (Webseiten, Bilder, Texte, Links...) zu erfassen und zu indexieren, um diese dann wiederum per Suchfunktion schnell aufzufinden. Sehr praktisch. Begleitet mich täglich.
summary: Gutes Programm zum Sammeln von Informationen aller Art

description:
Ich kenne kein anderes Programm, das mir so wichtig geworden ist. Und ich benütze Zim schon seit Jahren täglich und andauernd, um alles Mögliche zu dokumentieren. Das Speichern der Texte (Endung txt) und Anhänge (Bilder usw.) in der Datenbank (Ordner) geschieht automatisch. So kann ich die ganze entstandene Datenbank auf einem USB-Stick haben und kann das Grundprogramm auf verschiedenen Computern installiert haben. Und den Stick stecke ich mal da, mal dort ein, und das Grundprogramm zeigt mir alles auf jedem Computer, in den der Stick jeweils eingesteckt ist, schön geordnet, wie ich es will. Die automatische Verlinkung habe ich ausgeschaltet und erstelle selbst Links zwischen den Texten/Seiten. Alles lässt sich auch gut umsortieren. Auch die Suchfunktion über alle Seiten hinweg ist exzellent. Da finde ich alles schnell. Die Konfigurationsdatei style.conf lässt sich auf jedem Computer, auf dem ich das Grundprogramm installiert habe, anpassen, sodass ich z.B. die Titelschriften auf dem einen Computer so habe, auf einem anderen Computer anders. Es gibt ganz viele Plugins (z.B. Zeilensortierer, Tabellen). Die Seiten kann man als html-Seite "ausdrucken" - sie werden beim "Ausdrucken" sofort im Default-Browser dargestellt (allerdings in einer Default-Darstellung, nicht gemäss der selbst erstellten Style.conf). 
Das Programm ist nicht perfekt, aber es bietet sehr, sehr viel. Und es ist sehr stabil und trotz allem übersichtlich. Ich glaube nicht, dass es ein anderes Programm gibt, das diese Qualität hat.
Dieses Programm ist mein unverzichtbarer Helfer zur Wissens- und Aufgabenorganisation. Wirklich gelungen und dh sehr empfehlenswert.
Jede Analyse und persönliche Doku lege ich so ab. Besser wie alles andere.

Ich nutze ZIM schon seit Jahren und es gibt kein Programm, dass sich mit ihm messen könnte.
Allerdings hat es auch einen Haken. Nach fast jedem Update muss ich meine Lesezeichen immer wieder neu setzen!
Und auch die Ansicht (Pfadleiste) verliert nach fast jedem Update seine Einstellung!
Es ist extrem nervig, dies jedesmal wieder alles neu einstellen zu müssen.
Ansonsten ist dieses Programm wirklich nur zu empfehlen!
summary: Gutes Programm, aber leider mit einem Fehler

description: Es un complemento a One Note, tiene todo lo necesario para organizar las notas y apuntes, que ayudan a mejorar el flujo de trabajo.
summary: Todos tus apuntes y notas al alcance de la mano

description: Esta muy bueno, lo unico que no me gusta es que el indice se organiza automaticamente en orden alfanumerico y no lo puedo modificar sin colocar exclusivamente un numero o letra al inicio del título.
Excelente alternativa a Onenote
Sencilla de usar y potente
Cumple muy bien su objetivo. Totalmente recomendable. La interfaz muy bien integrada a Gnome.
Idéale pour organiser ses idées ou des articles, je recommande pour ceux qui ont beaucoup d'infos à organiser !
Outil indispensable pour organiser ses notes.
Très simple d'utilisation pour prendre des notes ou créer un petit classeur, genre recette de cuisine
Un wiki sur son bureau Très simple et très efficace pour gérer ses notes (rdv, recettes, listes, todo etc)

Utilisant des PC sous Windows au travail, nous avions mis en commun des données pratiques, liens vers des procédures, etc. sous OneNotes. La nouvelle version catastrophique (partiellement incompatible avec l'ancienne, buguée, lente, lourde), nous a conduits à chercher un substitut. 
Zim est parfait, léger, pratique et en plus compatible avec mes anciennes données en wiki.
Une réussite !
summary: Aussi pratique à la maison qu'au travail

description: Parfais pour organiser ses notes. Permet de mettre des printscreen. Bravo!
Great app for notes following the WYSWG-principle. Unfortunately, I was looking for a Markdown-styled noting app, like Typora.

À ranger au rayon gadget. 
Je viens de perdre mon travail avec pour seul information un message m'anonçant le crash d'une application.
simple d'usage et disposant de fonctions efficients pour capitaliser, organiser, formaliser avec l'hypertexte du wiki
summary: très bon outil pour alimenter sa base de connaissance au quotidien

description: Je me sers de cette application depuis plus de 10 ans. encore aujourd'hui je retrouve facilement les informations de plusieurs années. simple, pratique, utile.
Je voulais une app de notes/todos qui puissent siéger dans le system tray. En désespoir de cause, je tente Zim, qui non seulement le fait, mais fait bien mieux encore. Enfin !
summary: En fait + ce qu'on lui demande

description:
Prendre des notes, des liens, sous forme de dossiers organisés en arborescence...
La structure des bloc-notes est sous forme de dossiers/fichiers, simple à sauvegarder, à ouvrir
Recherche par mots clés; mise en forme simple sans gadget.
Rien à dire fonctionne bien, simple et efficace, tout ce qu'on demande pour prendre des notes.

L'outil fonctionne correctement !

Deux trois petite chose a revoir en terme de praticité.

Les fichiers généré derirre l'interface sont des fichiers textes donc lisible facilement par une autre application.
Prendre des notes, prendre des captures d'écran sans prise de tête.

Само приложение очень удобное. Позволяет организовать заметки в иерархию страниц. На каждой странице - много текста, поддерживает заголовки. Можно создавать элементы с чек-боксами.
Также можно организовать страницы по датам.
summary: Очень удобное приложение, все заметки в текстовых файлах

description: Пользуюсь zim-ом более 8 лет. По моему мнению очень удобная программа для заметок.
Хороший и удобный древовидный органайзер.
Как в этом говне увеличить текст?
Не дает содавать блокнот на примонтированном диске, а также в Dropbox. Как-то странно это. Зачем мне блокнот без синхронизации?

Уважение разработчикам за труд и за то, что такое приложение бесплатно.
Очень удобно и интуитивно. 
Было бы неплохо добавить некий журнал перемещений заметок и папок в программе.
经常使用，非常棒，可以用来随手记点东西、当日记用。附件可以用来整理文件夹。
summary: 经常使用，非常棒，可以用来随手记点东西、当日记

description: 随手笔记.如果支持markdown,导出PDF,自定义插件 就更好了
为什么提示获取GPG密钥失败，怎么解决
很好，但为什么windows版本的不能更新了？
